entry.title: Hello Markdown World
entry.summary: Below is a document produced by markdown syntax: Paragraphs are separatedby a blank line. Two spaces at the end of a line produces a line break. bold, monospace. Horizontal rule: Strikethrough: strikethrough Bullet list: Numbered list: An example. Markdown uses email-style characters for blockquoting. Inline…
entry.content:
Below is a document produced by markdown syntax:

Heading

Sub-heading

Paragraphs are separated by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line
produces a line break.

bold, monospace.

Horizontal rule:

Strikethrough:
strikethrough

Bullet list:

  • apples
  • oranges
  • pears

Numbered list:

  1. lather
  2. rinse
  3. repeat

An example.

Markdown uses email-style characters for blockquoting.

Inline HTML is supported.

Above content was generated using the below Markdown syntax:

# Heading

## Sub-heading

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line  
produces a line break.

**bold**, `monospace`.

Horizontal rule:

---

Strikethrough:  
~~strikethrough~~

Bullet list:

  * apples
  * oranges
  * pears

Numbered list:

  1. lather
  2. rinse
  3. repeat

An [example](http://example.com).

![Image](Icon-pictures.png "icon")

> Markdown uses email-style 
> characters for blockquoting.

Inline <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> is supported.

entry.title: Markdown Document Structure
entry.summary: Markdown documents are a sequence of Blocks - structural elements like paragraphs, block quotations, lists, headings, rules, and code blocks. Some blocks (like block quotes and list items) contain other blocks; others (like headings and paragraphs) contain inline contents - text, links, emphasized text, images,…
entry.content:
Markdown documents are a sequence of Blocks - structural elements like paragraphs, block quotations, lists, headings, rules, and code blocks.

Some blocks (like block quotes and list items) contain other blocks; others (like headings and paragraphs) contain inline contents - text, links, emphasized text, images, code spans, and so on.

Container blocks and Leaf blocks

We can divide blocks into two types:

  1. Container Blocks
  2. Leaf Blocks

Container blocks can contain other blocks, and Leaf blocks cannot.

Container blocks

  • Paragraphs
  • Block Quotations
  • Lists
  • Headings
  • Rules
  • Code blocks

Leaf blocks

  • Thematic breaks
  • ATX headings
  • Setext headings
  • Indented code blocks
  • Fenced code blocks
  • HTML blocks
  • Link reference definitions
  • Paragraphs
  • Blank lines
  • Tables (GitHub specific extension)

Inline contents

  • Backslash escapes
  • Entity and numeric character references
  • Code spans
  • Emphasis and strong emphasis
  • Strikethrough (extension)
  • Links
  • Images
  • Autolinks
  • Autolinks (extension)
  • Raw HTML
  • Disallowed Raw HTML (extension)
  • Hard line breaks
  • Soft line breaks
  • Textual content
